slides.content: How a perfect storm of demand shifts, supply shocks, and geopolitics stretched lead times, idled factories, and reshaped industrial policy—and what resilient operators did differently.

slides.title: Root Causes: A Convergence of Shocks

pandemic_and_ops: COVID demand whiplash: early auto cancellations, then sharp rebound
Factory disruptions: lockdowns; Texas freeze (2021); Japan fab fire; Malaysia OSAT lockdowns
demand_mix_shift: Automotive electrification/ADAS content up; consoles/GPUs cycles
industry_structure: Tight mature-node capacity (90–28nm, 8-inch lines) for MCUs/analog/power
Long equipment lead times; capex prioritized at advanced nodes
geopolitics_and_policy: Logistics constraints and component allocation practices

slides.slide_design: Four-quadrant cause map with concise bullets; each quadrant labeled and icon-tagged

slides.title: Resilience Playbook: From Firefighting to Foresight

workstreams.name: Governance & Data
actions: Central BOM risk registry with part-to-node mapping
Allocation cockpit: confirmed-to-book (CTB), PPV, lead-time telemetry
Quarterly risk reviews with exec steering

workstreams.name: Supply & Commercial
actions: LTA and capacity reservations for top 50 risk parts
Second-source roadmap; dual OSAT where feasible
Supplier segmentation and joint recovery drills

workstreams.name: Engineering & Product
actions: Alternate-approved parts list (AAPL) and design abstraction
Qualification fast lanes for non-safety critical SKUs
